page.title: 13COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: The Morton Manor Community Centre plays a significant role in the life of the area.Situated in beautiful open parkland it was formerly the home of the Ferguson Chance family.The house was presented to the people in 1960 on the death of Sir Robert Chance but it was not opened as a community center until 1965. The center is today used by 3000 to 4000 people a week it is open six days a week from 9.00 am to 10.00 pm.There is a full time staff led by a warden who looks after all the day to day workings of the center but they are accountable to a management committee composed of local people and councillors.Every one who uses the centre has to become a member and has to pay a fee dependant upon age.The young members and old age pensioners pay least.
